data.title: All 38 Liv Tyler Movies (in Order)
data.meta_description: Are you a fan of Liv Tyler, the talented actress known for her roles in blockbuster movies like “Lord of the Rings” and “Armageddon”? If so, get ready to embark on a cinematic journey as we take a…
data.text:
Are you a fan of Liv Tyler, the talented actress known for her roles in blockbuster movies like “Lord of the Rings” and “Armageddon”?

If so, get ready to embark on a cinematic journey as we take a closer look at the diverse range of movies in which Liv Tyler has starred. From action-packed thrillers to romantic dramas, our roundup of Liv Tyler’s filmography covers it all. Join us as we revisit some of her most memorable on-screen performances and delve into her inspiring career.

1. Silent Fall (1994)

In the gripping 1994 drama “Silent Fall, “ a young autistic boy named Jamie (played by Skylar Astin) witnesses his parents’ brutal murder. As police struggle to uncover the truth behind the gruesome crime, a controversial therapist named Dr. Kessler (John Lithgow) boldly seeks to delve into Jamie’s mind. To crack the dark family secret, Dr. Kessler must confront his own limits and the complexities of the human spirit.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

2. Aerosmith: Big Ones You Can Look At (1994)

Aerosmith: Big Ones You Can Look At” is a captivating home video accompaniment to the band’s compilation album, “Big Ones. “ This 1994 release presents all of Aerosmith’s music videos from their Geffen Records era, promising fans an immersive musical experience. The video features various exhilarating elements, including motorcycles, skydiving, computer animations, and virtual reality. Directed by renowned filmmakers Marty Callner and David Fincher, this one-hour forty-minute celebration of Aerosmith’s music highlights their iconic hits and the band’s undeniable charisma.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

4. Heavy (1995)

Heavy”, a 1995 drama-romance film directed and written by James Mangold, explores the life of an overweight, unhappy cook who works alongside his mother at a road-side restaurant. His lonely existence is turned upside down when a kind and beautiful college drop-out comes to work as a waitress at the same establishment.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

5. That Thing You Do! (1996)

That Thing You Do! “ is a heartwarming and nostalgic musical comedy-drama released in 1996, directed and written by Tom Hanks himself. Set in the iconic 1960s, this captivating tale follows a local band from Erie, Pennsylvania, as they experience a burst of fame with their one-hit wonder in 1964. The movie is filled with laughter and emotional highs and lows as the members of the band and their dedicated manager navigate the intricacies of the music industry.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

6. Stealing Beauty (1996)

Stealing Beauty” is a gripping drama, mystery, and romance film directed by renowned filmmaker Bernardo Bertolucci, revolving around a young woman’s journey to self-discovery and love. Set against the backdrop of Tuscany, it follows its protagonist, who seeks solace from the heartbreak of her mother’s suicide. As she embarks on a profound exploration of her identity, she encounters a complex web of deep emotions, love, and self-exploration that eventually lead to her sexual awakening.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

8. U Turn (1997)

Directed by Oliver Stone and written by John Ridley, U Turn is a gripping crime drama that follows the story of a man on a desperate mission to pay off his gambling debt before he is killed by the Russian mafia. However, his journey takes an unexpected detour through an Arizona town, where everything goes terribly wrong.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

10. Onegin (1999)

Onegin, “ a 1999 period drama film directed by Martha Fiennes, takes place in Russia in the 1820s. The story revolves around the protagonist, Onegin, who inherits his uncle’s country estate in the city of St. Petersburg and moves there. Onegin befriends his neighbor, Lensky, and they encounter Tatyana, a woman who falls deeply in love with Onegin. However, Onegin only desires friendship from Tatyana, leaving her heartsick and tormented.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

12. Cookie’s Fortune (1999)

Discover the uproarious and heartfelt saga of Cookie’s Fortune, as the quaint town of Holly Springs grapples with an unexpected turn of events. After the passing of an elderly woman, the story takes a drastic turn, resulting in a series of reactions from the family and friends involved in the inheritance.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

13. Dr. T & the Women (2000)

From the mind of esteemed director Robert Altman comes the hilarious and heartfelt movie, “Dr. T & the Women. “ This unforgettable 2000 film, starring Helen Hunt, Farrah Fawcett, and Richard Gere, follows the life of a wealthy gynecologist whose world is turned upside down when the women in his life decide to shake things up. Laced with intrigue, drama, and romance, this film is a must-see comedy with a unique flair.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

14. One Night at McCool’s (2001)

One Night at McCool’s” is a darkly comedic film that brings together an unusual ensemble of characters for a night of chaos and intrigue. The film follows the story of a mysterious and alluring woman who causes havoc in the lives of several men, each remembering the events of that heated night in different ways.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

15. The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (2001)

Embark on an epic adventure as ‘The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring’ takes you on a thrilling journey through Middle-earth. In this masterpiece by Director Peter Jackson, a meek Hobbit named Frodo, along with eight brave companions, embarks on a quest to destroy the One Ring and thwart the wicked Dark Lord Sauron.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

16. The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers (2002)

The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers, set in the enchanting and perilous land of Middle Earth, follows Frodo and Sam as they journey closer to Mordor, the dark fortress of the infamous Sauron. Meanwhile, the divided fellowship confronts a new adversary, Saruman, and his sinister Isengard troops.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

17. The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King (2003)

The epic conclusion to J. R. R. Tolkien’s famous trilogy, “The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King, “ brings together an ensemble of diverse characters united in their quest to destroy the all-powerful One Ring, the very source of evil in Middle Earth. As the dark forces led by the malevolent Sauron close relentlessly, the fate of the world hangs in the balance.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

18. Jersey Girl (2004)

Jersey Girl” is a heartwarming comedy-drama film released in 2004, starring Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, and Raquel Castro. The film follows a widower named Ollie Trinke, portrayed by Affleck, who is left to raise his precocious daughter after facing an unexpected tragedy and a professional setback. Directed by Kevin Smith, this movie takes the audience on a roller coaster ride of emotions as Ollie tries to make sense of his newfound responsibilities and rebuild his life.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

19. The 76th Annual Academy Awards (2004)

The 76th Annual Academy Awards, also known as the Oscars, is a prestigious annual event where the film industry comes together to celebrate cinematic achievements of the previous year. The 2004 ceremony showcases a range of nominated films, including epic masterpiece “The Return of the King, “ the poignant drama “Lost in Translation, “ the historical epic “Master and Commander, “ the gripping crime-thriller “Mystic River, “ and the heartwarming sports story “Seabiscuit. “ The event, hosted by the talented Billy Crystal, is renowned for its live performances, humorous moments, and heartwarming tributes to the film industry. This Academy Awards ceremony, held in 2004, demonstrates the extraordinary talents and contributions of the film industry in the 2000s, with a remarkable lineup of nominees and an unforgettable night of celebration.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

20. Cameras in Middle-Earth (2004)

Cameras in Middle-Earth” is a captivating documentary that takes you behind the scenes of the epic film, “The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King” (2003). Released on December 14, 2004, the movie gives an intimate glimpse into the intricate processes of bringing Peter Jackson’s magnificent story to life on the big screen.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

21. Lonesome Jim (2005)

Lonesome Jim, “ a heartwarming comedy-drama released in 2005, follows the life of Jim, a 27-year-old man who struggles to find his footing in life. His inability to break free from his family’s expectations leads him to move back in with his parents. Through his journey, he learns the importance of personal growth, self-discovery, and the strength of family bonds.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

22. Ringers: Lord of the Fans (2005)

Ringers: Lord of the Fans” is a captivating documentary that delves into the profound influence of “The Lord of the Rings” on Western popular culture over the past 50 years. With a runtime of 1 hour and 37 minutes, the film is a mix of documentary and comedy genres, providing a unique blend of entertainment and insight.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

24. Happy Birthday Elton! From Madison Square Garden, New York (2007)

Happy Birthday Elton! From Madison Square Garden, New York” captures the essence of an iconic moment in history. In a celebration of Elton John’s 60th birthday, the musician performs an impressive 60th sold-out show at the iconic Madison Square Garden. The event features an array of celebrity appearances, including some of the world’s most recognized names, such as Whoopi Goldberg, President Bill Clinton, and Robin Williams.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

26. The Incredible Hulk (2008)

The Incredible Hulk” (2008) brings the green-skinned, mighty Marvel character to life once more. Directed by Louis Leterrier, this explosive action-adventure film introduces the world to Bruce Banner (played by Edward Norton), a scientist who is on the run from the U. S. Government. When anger strikes, Banner transforms into the raging monster known as The Incredible Hulk, a transformation he desperately seeks to cure.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

27. Smother (2008)

Smother” is a lighthearted comedy-drama that follows the story of an ordinary man, recently fired from his job, and the unexpected challenges he faces in his personal life. As he gets pressured by his ambitious wife about starting a family, his life takes a sudden turn when his controlling mother decides to move in with the couple. “Smother” is a story of love, family, and the struggle to find a balance between parental expectations and personal ambitions.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

28. The Strangers (2008)

Experience heart-pounding terror in “The Strangers” (2008), directed by Bryan Bertino and written by the same mastermind. Follow a young couple, James (Scott Speedman) and Kristen (Liv Tyler), who find themselves trapped in an isolated vacation home, pursued by three masked intruders. The once tranquil retreat quickly becomes a nightmarish nightmare as they are subjected to a series of unsettling and unexpected threats.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

29. Super (2010)

Super” (2010) is a thrilling and darkly humorous action-comedy film that follows an unprepared average guy who transforms into a superhero, Crimson Bolt, after his wife succumbs to the cruel grip of a dangerous drug dealer. Boasting a captivating and thought-provoking plot, the film explores the themes of power, tragedy, and the blurred lines between hero and villain.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

32. Final Cut: Ladies and Gentlemen (2012)

Final Cut: Ladies and Gentlemen” is a heartwarming and unique blend of comedy, drama, and romance. This 2012 film was masterfully directed by György Pálfi and written by Pálfi and Zsófia Ruttkay. The movie tells a simple yet timeless love story between a man and a woman, brought to life through a series of scenes edited together from hundreds of classic films, creating a delightful crossover of movie genres.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

37. Wildling (2018)

Wildling, released in 2018, is a captivating drama, fantasy, and horror film that tells the story of a young teenager’s journey towards uncovering the truth about her tumultuous past. Starring an excellent ensemble cast, including Bel Powley, Brad Dourif, and Liv Tyler, the film follows the protagonist’s blossoming teenage years as she wrestles with the dark secrets hidden within her traumatic experiences. Directed by Fritz Böhm and written by Böhm and Florian Eder, Wildling is a thrilling and chilling exploration of coming-of-age, the blurred lines between innocence and darkness, and the unforgettable impact a mysterious man can have on an unsuspecting child.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

38. Ad Astra (2019)

Ad Astra is a gripping adventure drama set against the vast, unforgiving landscape of space. Written and directed by James Gray, the movie follows astronaut Roy McBride (Brad Pitt) on an epic journey across the solar system in search of the truth about his missing father, who was part of a doomed expedition that now, 30 years later, poses a grave threat to the universe.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

That’s All Folks!
